reviews.text: Mooloolaba backpackers was a nice hostel, fairly clean, but could probably do with some cosmetic work in the communal areas, but its a backpackers hostel, so you shouldn't be expecting 5***** anyway. The hostel does what is says on the tin, good location, and almost all of the staff are amazing. There are a lot of people staying here who are long term and working, so it can be slightly clicky at times, but everyone pulls together for evening activities. IT can be noisy in the evening but you are not forced to join in and do anything.
reviews.title: Good hostel.... good location.....good people....

reviews.text: Good location 5 minutes walk from the beach and free board hire is a bonus. Worth staying here if you visit mooloolaba, as you will have an amazing time
reviews.title: Mooloolaba Backpackers - Best on Sunshine Coast!

reviews.text: I've been staying at Mooloolaba Backpackers for almost 2 weeks now. It is the only hostel in Mooloolaba, and is located about 5 minutes walk from the beach. Now you would think that because they're the only hostel here, they might drop the ball a bit and not bother to organize events or try very hard. Not at all. Every night there is something on. Sometimes it's food related (last night they had wood-fired pizzas for only $2), sometimes it's alcohol-related (Thursday night is goon-pong night (goon is wine)) and sometimes there are excursions and activities. But the best thing is that there is no obligation to do any of these. If you just want to chill out then you can do that too.
reviews.title: Fun people, great activities, perfect location :)

reviews.text: The hostel has all usual hostel things (pool table, Internet, laundry etc) but also a couple of things I haven't seen in many other hostels (swimming pool, table-tennis table, free hire of surfboards and paddle boards). The do free breakfast every morning which has been very useful for me, and there is a tour desk if you are needing to book trips or plan onward travel.
reviews.title: Friendly laid-back atmosphere, near the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am staying in an ensuite dorm room, which is a little more expensive than a standard dorm, but worth it in my opinion. The whole hostel is cleaned thoroughly every day, and the staff and friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Spartan Budget Hostel with nice staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean Hostel with modern facilities, friendly staff and free internet. Staff dont seem to do much but apart from that i cannot say anything negative about this place.
reviews.title: good place
The cost is the only pro
reviews.text: One of the cheapest places we stayed in Aus. But by far the worst. The standard of backpackers in Aus can be far better than you can imagine... this one was verging at the very edge of fair / bad.

The worn carpet tiles hadn't been hoovered for weeks - when you walked barefoot other people's dirt was attached to your feet. The bed simply had no support left in the mattress and left us with a bad back for a week.
reviews.title: Easygoing, friendly vibe

likes.disliked: — The dripping tap in the bathroom

reviews.title: Get what you pay for...
reviews.text: Australia's backpackers are definitely the way to do Aus. They're generally of quite a high standard of basic comfort.
If you want as cheap as poss then stay here. But I wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was the first time i'd bought my boyfriend to Oz, I wanted him to see the amazing beach where I have so many fantastic childhood holiday memories. Unfortuantely we arrived right smack bang in the middle of school holidays when you can't get a room for less than 3 nights under $150. We booked a double room with ensuite for $70 and have to say it did the job nicely...wasn't too noisey as it was midweek, and the staff were very friendly. As we were heading back to Brisbane in the afternoon, they let us keep the car in the carpark while we had a swim.
reviews.title: Did the job nicely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a five minute stroll to the beach, and close to the wharf as well. I noticed they also had meal options at the hotel which were very reasonably priced if you're on a budget.
reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice one Mooloolaba - you never disappoint!
reviews.title: Relaxed hostel with a good vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $28 for a dorm you expect more. We were in a 4bed dorm which was clean but the bunkbeds made more noise than you can imagine, no one could sleep if you just turned over. Doors were slamming all through the night because they do not have anything to slow them down. Alot of people seem to be working on farms here so you get alot of noise at 5am. The showers were not hot and just dribbled on you.
reviews.title: Great little secret

reviews.text: The curfews were all at 8pm, I dont like to stay up all night every night but 8pm they stop you goin out on your balcony which is ridiculas. It is not a cheerful place to be and for a more expensive hostel i expected better facilities and service.
reviews.title: Australia would'nt have been the same without it...

reviews.text: I had a really great itme here, but it was mostly because of the wonderful people I met and stayed with here for several weeks. The hostel itself is kinda run down and dirty, with an ill equipped kitchen, and bathrooms that get filthy because there is no separation of the shower to the rest of the floor. We told one cleaner about this and he said he didn't care. Rooms dont get cleaned everyday (i guess because the cleaners dont care..) Despite all this I had an amazing time. the location is great, beach and nightclubs and pubs nearby. If service and cleanliness had been better this place would be getting 5 stars from me!
reviews.title: Great time because of my fellow travellers

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at Mooloolaba Beach Backpackers for only 1 night. We stayed in an ensuite bedroom. It was pretty clean, we're happy about that. We met only one staff and she was friendly enough.
reviews.title: Not terrific but ok

reviews.text: We love the location as it's quite near to the wharf and underwater world.
reviews.title: Good clean backpackers - double room decent bed.

reviews.text: We left early so we didn't have the breakfast. There is a kitchen but the kettles are worn and stained pretty badly. Utensils are not very clean.
reviews.title: Awesome place, Amazing People, Epic Location

reviews.text: Nevertheless, we had a comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Don't do it... Unless you're really tight on a budget...
